'''Noibat''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''オンバット''' ''Onbat'') is a dual-type {{2t|Flying|Dragon}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation VI]].

It [[Evolution|evolves]] into {{p|Noivern}} starting at [[level]] 48.

==Biology==
Noibat is a lavender bat-like Pokémon. It has two clawed fingers on each wing and two long toes on each foot. Noibat's hips and chest are covered in black fur. It has large yellow eyes, two purple teardrop-shaped spots on the front of its face, and large teardrop-shaped ears that resemble loudspeakers. When its mouth is open, two pointed teeth can be seen on its lower jaw.

Noibat is capable of emitting ultrasonic waves of 200,000 Hertz from its ears, which it can use to stun large creatures, immobilize prey, and determine the ripeness of fruit it enjoys eating. It also uses ultrasonic waves as a means to communicate with other Noibat<ref>http://www.pokemonxy.com/en-us/pokemon/other_pokemon/#Noibat</ref>.

===Major appearances===
====[[Ash's Noibat]]====
Ash's Noibat hatched from an {{pkmn|Egg}} in ''[[XY076|A Not-So-Flying Start!]]''. He evolved into a Noivern in ''[[XY110|An Electrifying Rage!]]''.

====Other====
Multiple Noibat debuted in ''[[XY033|Calling from Beyond the Aura!]]'', where they encountered {{Ash}} and {{ashfr}} after they were agitated by {{TRT}}.

A Noibat appeared in ''[[PK26|Pikachu, What's This Key?]]''.

===Minor appearances===
A Noibat appeared in ''[[M17|Diancie and the Cocoon of Destruction]]''.

Multiple Noibat appeared in the Hoopa's Surprise Ring Adventures short ''{{DL|Hoopa's Surprise Ring Adventures|In the Dark}}''.

==Trivia==
* Noibat has the lowest base stat total of all {{type|Dragon}} Pokémon. 
** In addition, Noibat has the lowest base {{stat|HP}} and {{stat|Attack}} stats of any Dragon-type Pokémon, and ties with {{p|Goomy}} for having the lowest base {{stat|Defense}} among all Dragon-type Pokémon.
* Noibat's German name, eF-eM, is the only Pokémon name that uses the Latin alphabet and does not start with a capital letter.
* Noibat and its evolution, {{p|Noivern}}, are the only dual {{type|Flying}} Pokémon to have Flying as their primary type.
* Originally, Noibat's Pokédex entry on the official Pokémon website was incorrect, showing it as a pure {{type|Flying}} Pokémon. It has been since rectified.
* Noibat can be seen as a parallel to {{p|Zubat}}, as they are both {{type|Flying}} Pokémon based on bats and can have {{a|Infiltrator}} as a possible Ability.

===Origin===
Noibat may be based on a bat, and the design of its ears may be based on speakers.

====Name origin====
Noibat is a combination of ''noise'' and ''{{wp|bat}}''.

Onbat may be a combination of 音 ''on'' (sound), 音波 ''onpa'' (sound wave), and バット ''bat''.
